text.text:
Excellent üëå

Attended 5 days management training

What a university it is. It's definitely no 1 in Asia. Professors so down to earth and humble. Knowledge top notch. Program design very professional. Environment & Ambiance perfect.

10/10 for education
10/10 for arrangements
10/10 multicultural sensibilities

For instance I told I m Muslim, they indicated the food served there is hallal certified to carer all delegate. Plus they had small quirt room designated for prayers.

I wish I come here more often.

text.text:
Sad to see well-run courses like NUS Real Estate being relocated under Biz.

Last I checked, the faculty is indeed business-minded when it comes to offering spots to (in my humble opinion) less-qualified international students who want ‚ÄúNUS‚Äù to be in their resume into their MSc programmes for easy income (~S$65k + GST in 2021) and maybe diversity.

Overrated and (yet again in my humble opinion), doesn‚Äôt live up to the international ranking. Simply put, the place feels like a face to face LinkedIn.

text.text: Great school. No.1 MBA/EMBA in APAC

originalText.text: Great school. No.1 MBA/EMBA in APAC

text.text:
Generally a very pretty looking campus, and an extremely functional Mochtar Riady building. Many pretty decorations being put up, and is more so catered for Executive education. Very clean, systematic, and conducive.

Information and Admissions office is located on the 2nd floor above The Spread cafe / restaurant, in case you're in need of some walk in enquiries.

A little hard to get to, but once you get the drift of things, this is actually quite straightforward to be attending your business classes at.

text.text: Just attended 2 days course. Car park 15 is 5 mins walk away. Building is just opposite the main road. But it took me a while to locate it‚Ä¶ wifi is ok only. The phone line is not stable inside the building.
